bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, September 24, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison feels Kissinger and Moran may resent the honoring of Cooke.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, September 24, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
September 24, 1940

div1.p:
I am just wondering about Doctor Cooke.
From what you say and from what the notes indicated
about him, might not Kissinger and Moran somewhat
resent his being received here on the same plane
as they themselves? Would we not be smarter
perhaps to just have the two of them and give them
a good time? This is the hunch I have after reading
your note received today. Let me know what you think.
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
